EXTRACTED VALUE: It's a small game stretched out by using repetition. But you'll love what there is of it. [Christmas 2007, p.74]
Race Driver: GRID is tearing up the tarmac this summer without a challenger in site.
The first truly "next-gen" Tony Hawk game looks and plays great.
We've actually been waiting for this game for years, ever since people started coining the term, "next-gen." Thankfully, that time has finally come.
The improved accessibility is welcome, the deepened career mode is great and the overall presentation quality can't be overlooked.
The astounding level of variety that is packed into the game is wonderful to see.
Silky smooth graphics accompany spot-on controls.
You're in for one hell of a good time. [Oct 2007, p.108]
A bit pricey for a game so close to "Bejeweled," but the RPG element genuinely adds to the package. [Christmas 2007, p.98]
At the very least, it's the best-looking and -playing open-world game this side of "Oblivion" on the X360 right now.
